availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W Hart (Clark County, Kentucky, constable)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, constable. Son of Thomas Hart and Lucy Hart. Married to Sarah M Franklin Hart in Clark County, Kentucky, on April 16, 1857. Father of Joel T. Hart. Farmer in Clark County in 1850. Constable in Clark County in 1860. Resident in Clark County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 93B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 957.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Blue Ball, p. 20B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Clark County, KY, July 1863.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film #001943687, p. 26.
"John W. Hart (1830-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #108031411, accessed December 3, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/108031411.
